title: RFK Jr.’s New Advisers Rescind Recommendations for Some Flu Vaccines
summary: Critics saw in the move the beginnings of a more restrictive approach to providing vaccines to Americans.

title: C.D.C. Committee Votes Against Flu Shots With the Preservative Thimerosal
summary: A C.D.C. advisory committee on Thursday voted against flu shots that contain the ingredient.

title: Senate Republicans Reprise Push to Pay for Tax Cuts by Slashing Food Stamps
summary: Party lawmakers have devised a way around an earlier procedural roadblock to their safety-net cuts.

title: Trump Administration Tells Congress to Kill ‘Revenge Tax’ From Policy Bill
summary: Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent said the Group of 7 had agreed that penalties related to a 2021 “global minimum tax” deal would not apply to American companies.

title: Trump Justice Dept. Pressuring University of Virginia President to Resign
summary: The Justice Department has demanded that James E. Ryan step down to help resolve a civil rights investigation into the school, three people familiar with the matter said.

title: How the Republican Agenda Could Hit Johns Hopkins University
summary: The university is not a direct target of the Trump administration but faces some of the biggest cuts, as Republicans seek to trim government spending.

title: House Panel Subpoenas Harvard in Tuition-Pricing Inquiry
summary: The subpoena letter adds yet another front to the battle between the university and Republicans in Washington.

title: Justice Dept. Opens Inquiry Into University of California Hiring Practices
summary: The Trump administration has targeted the state system as part of its broad effort to eliminate diversity, equity and inclusion initiatives and programs.

title: Fate of Iran’s Enriched Uranium Is a Mystery
summary: U.S. intelligence agencies had long assessed that, faced with the possibility of an attack on its nuclear facilities, Iran would try to move its stockpile.

title: Iran’s Foreign Minister Says Nuclear Facilities ‘Seriously Damaged’
summary: The assessment came hours after the country’s supreme leader had downplayed the damage the U.S. strikes had caused.

title: What We Know About the Fate of Iran’s Nuclear Program
summary: President Trump’s claimed Iran’s capabilities were “obliterated.” The full extent of the damage is still emerging.

title: He Searched for His Past in Children’s Books. He Found His Wife’s.
summary: Steve Mills has been collecting secondhand books in England to reawaken lost memories. His search revealed more about his family’s past than he thought possible.

title: Bill Moyers, Presidential Aide and Veteran of Public TV, Dies at 91
summary: He was a renowned television correspondent and commentator who also had long ties with Lyndon B. Johnson, including as his press secretary.

title: Justice Dept. Says the Trump Administration Plans to Re-Deport Abrego Garcia
summary: The assertion raised questions about how seriously the administration takes the criminal charges filed against the migrant. A White House official reiterated support for prosecuting him in America.

title: Trump’s Tariffs Have Unsettled Thailand’s Pet Food Exporters
summary: After rapid growth, Thailand is the biggest overseas supplier of pet food in the United States. Volatility in policy has some importers looking elsewhere.

title: As Mamdani Rises, Anti-Muslim Attacks Roll In From the Right
summary: Republican members of Congress and Trump administration officials have targeted Zohran Mamdani, who would be New York City’s first Muslim mayor.

title: The Parents Who Helped Shape Zohran Mamdani’s Politics
summary: Zohran Mamdani’s parents, a filmmaker and a professor, gave him the foundation for his run for mayor of New York. But their own political views may open him up to attacks.

title: ‘Re-elect Eric’: Adams Kicks Off Bid to Oppose Mamdani for Mayor
summary: Just a few months ago, it appeared unlikely that Mayor Eric Adams of New York, who was facing federal corruption charges, would be in a position to seek a second term.

title: U.S. Approves $30 Million for Contentious New Gaza Aid Group
summary: The Israel-backed Gaza Humanitarian Foundation has been criticized by the United Nations and other aid groups, which say that its system exposes Gazans to danger.

title: Israel-Backed Aid Sites In Gaza Pose Lethal Risk for Palestinians Amid Deadly Fighting
summary: Hundreds of Palestinians have been killed over the past month near aid hubs set up under a new Israel-backed system, according to Gaza health officials.

title: Carolyn McCarthy, Who Turned a Gunman’s Massacre Into a Crusade, Dies at 81
summary: After her husband was killed and her son wounded on a Long Island commuter train in 1993, she went to Congress on a mission against gun violence.

title: 75 Years After a Deadly Plane Crash, the Search for Its Wreckage Ends
summary: In 2004, explorers began a search for a plane that crashed into Lake Michigan in 1950, killing 58 people. They didn’t find it, but they revived the history of what once was the country’s deadliest aviation accident.

title: Can Netanyahu Now Become a Statesman?
summary: This is the moment for Israel to move on from intense military operations to political statecraft.

title: Peter Thiel and the Antichrist
summary: The original tech right power player on A.I., Mars and immortality.

title: Anna Wintour Cedes Vogue Editor in Chief Title But Will Retain Editorial Control
summary: American Vogue will create a new role, “head of editorial content,” beneath Ms. Wintour, who is giving up her editor in chief title. She’s not leaving, though.

title: Tanner Martin Announces His Own Death
summary: Tanner Martin has documented his fight against colon cancer for hundreds of thousands of followers. His death was announced in a recorded video.

title: Florida Boaters Capture Twin Waterspouts Up Close on Video
summary: A family was heading back to dry land when two of the funnel formations suddenly sprung up. “It looked like something from a movie,” one of them said.
